learning_objectives.statement: Explain the value of digits in a whole number up to 1,000,000 using place value.
success_criteria: Correctly names each place value position
Explains why a digit’s value changes by position

learning_objectives.statement: Round whole numbers to the nearest 10, 100, and 1,000.
success_criteria: Uses correct rounding rule based on next digit
Shows a number line or step explanation

learning_objectives.statement: Solve real-world Liberia money problems using place value and rounding.
success_criteria: Identifies important information in the problem
Computes and explains the final answer with units (LD)

lesson_plan.opening: Quick warm-up: read 3 large numbers aloud and identify the thousands place.
lesson_plan.direct_instruction: Teach place value using CPA. Then teach rounding rules with a number line.
lesson_plan.guided_practice: Work 2 examples together using LD market prices.
lesson_plan.independent_practice: Students complete rounding practice set and explain reasoning.
lesson_plan.closing: Exit ticket: one place value question + one rounding question.
lesson_plan.extension: Accessibility: allow oral answers; provide number line template; extra challenge: estimate totals for 5 market items.

instructions.teacher: Model one example on the board. Ask students to explain digit values using the chart.
instructions.student: Draw a place value chart in your notebook (ones to hundred-thousands). Place digits from the teacher’s numbers into the chart.

activities.description: Students build a place value chart and place digits into columns.
activities.title: Place Value Chart (CPA: Pictorial → Abstract)

differentiation.advanced: Include numbers up to 1,000,000 and ask for expanded form.
differentiation.mixed_literacy: Use visuals and read instructions aloud; allow oral responses.
differentiation.struggling: Use numbers up to 10,000 and provide a pre-drawn chart template.

instructions.teacher: Model the first two. Then circulate and ask students 'Which digit decides?'
instructions.student: Round each LD price to the nearest 10, 100, and 1,000. Write one sentence explaining your rounding choice.

activities.description: Students round LD prices and explain why.
activities.title: Guided Practice: Rounding with Liberia Market Prices

differentiation.advanced: Add estimation: compare exact total vs rounded total for 5 items.
differentiation.mixed_literacy: Provide a worked example and allow verbal explanation.
differentiation.struggling: Start with rounding to nearest 10 only; use number lines.

analysis_questions: Why does the 'next digit' decide the rounding direction?
How does rounding help when shopping at the market?
virtual_labs.description: Students simulate rounding using a number line and decision digit.
virtual_labs.title: Rounding Simulator (Text-Guided)
virtual_labs.household_alternative: Use bottle caps or beans on a drawn number line to show moving up/down.

steps.ai_tutor_hint: Look at the digit immediately to the right.
steps.instruction: Write the number and circle the rounding place (10/100/1000).

steps.expected_observation: Student chooses up or down correctly.
steps.ai_tutor_hint: 5 or more means increase the rounding digit by 1.
steps.instruction: Check the next digit: 0–4 round down, 5–9 round up.

steps.expected_observation: Final rounded number has zeros in correct positions.
steps.ai_tutor_hint: Digits after the rounding place become 0.
steps.instruction: Replace all digits to the right with zeros and write final answer.

real_world_applications: Estimating total cost when shopping with limited cash
Reading big numbers in school fees or transport fares
local_examples: Using Liberian Dollars (LD) at Waterside Market to estimate prices
Buying rice, pepper, and oil in a local community market
Comparing distances and towns in Montserrado County
cultural_context.language_notes: Use clear simple English; allow learners to explain in Liberian English/Koloqua style before formal phrasing.
community_connections: Talk to a family member about how they estimate market prices
Find 3 prices at a local shop and practice rounding

hints: Find the place value column for 5.
questions.question: In the number 45,230, what is the value of the digit 5?
questions.explanation: The digit 5 is in the thousands place, so it represents 5,000.

hints: Check the tens digit to decide up/down.
questions.question: Round 6,742 to the nearest 100.
questions.explanation: To round to the nearest 100, look at the tens digit (4). 4 rounds down.

hints: Nearest 10 depends on the ones digit.
questions.question: Waterside Market: Rice costs LD 1,985. Round to the nearest 10.
questions.explanation: Nearest 10: look at the ones digit (5). 5 rounds up.

questions.question: Which statement is TRUE about place value?
questions.explanation: Place value means the position (ones, tens, hundreds…) changes a digit’s value.
options: A digit always has the same value.
A digit’s value depends on its position in the number.
questions.correct_answer: A digit’s value depends on its position in the number.

questions.question: Round 152,499 to the nearest 1,000.
questions.explanation: Nearest 1,000: look at the hundreds digit (4). 4 rounds down.

feedback.incorrect: Check the digit to the right of the rounding place and try again.
feedback.partial: You’re close—show your place value reasoning.
feedback.correct: Nice! You used place value and rounding correctly.

description: Offline-first mastery lesson using Liberian contexts (LD market examples).
parent_summary: Today your child learned place value and how to round numbers. You can help by asking them to round LD prices at the market.

prerequisite_check: Read and write whole numbers up to 100,000

common_misconceptions.correction: A digit’s value depends on place value (ones, tens, hundreds…).

common_misconceptions.misconception: Rounding to the nearest 100 means look at the hundreds digit.
common_misconceptions.correction: You look at the digit to the right (tens) to decide up or down.

common_misconceptions.misconception: If the next digit is 5, round down.
common_misconceptions.correction: 5 rounds up in standard rounding rules.

title: Grade 5 Math - Place Value & Rounding (Test Lesson)
